analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i chos ston pa po'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni rang bzhin med pa nyid kyang de kho na nyid du chos rnams kyi chos nyid de 'dis ston to zhes /
translated: The Tathagatas, who teach the undistorted Dharma, teach that the very absence of intrinsic nature is the thatness of phenomena.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rang gi rtogs pa dang mnyam par 'di'i chos ston pa 'gal ba ma yin par chos ston pa rtogs par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rang gi rtogs pa dang mnyam par 'di'i chos ston pa 'gal ba ma yin par chos ston pa rtogs par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: The Tathagatas teach this in order to help you understand the teaching of the Dharma, which is not contradictory with their own realization.

original: byang chub sems dpa' khyed rnams lta ci smos zhes bya ba ni re zhig byang chub sems dpa' rnams lta zhog ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' khyed rnams lta ci smos zhes bya ba ni re zhig byang chub sems dpa' rnams lta zhog ste /
translated: What need is there to speak of you, Bodhisattvas?

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyis stong pas 'dir yongs su mi shes so //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyis stong pas 'dir yongs su mi shes so //
translated: They are completely ignorant of it, because they are devoid of the gnosis of omniscience.

original: de thams cad mkhyen pa thams cad gzigs pas kyang sku la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yongs su mi shes so /
analyzed: de thams cad mkhyen pa thams cad gzigs pas kyang sku la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yongs su mi shes so /
translated: Even the Omniscient One, the All-Seeing One, does not know the nature of the body, etc.

original: 'dir rgyu gsungs pa /üîΩngo bo nyid med ces @283a * //
analyzed: 'dir rgyu gsungs pa / ngo bo nyid med ces @283a * //
translated: Here, the cause is stated:üîΩ‚ÄúWithout own-being,‚Äù etc.

original: bya ba la sogs pa la ngo bo nyid med pa ni de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: bya ba la sogs pa la ngo bo nyid med pa ni de bzhin nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúWithout own-being‚Äù is suchness.

original: de nyid rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir mi g-yo ba ni mi 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir mi g-yo ba ni mi 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Since that is the very nature, ‚Äúunmoving‚Äù means unchanging.

original: de las byung ba ni /
analyzed: de las byung ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúArisen from that‚Äù

original: de rtogs pa las skye zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de rtogs pa las skye zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: means ‚Äúarisen from the realization of that.‚Äù

original: de nyid kyi phyir skye ba med pa'i bdag nyid ni rdo rje mngon par byang chub pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir skye ba med pa'i bdag nyid ni rdo rje mngon par byang chub pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the vajra-enlightenment is the very nature of non-arising.

original: sems can rnams kyang de'i ngo bor rtogs par bya ba'i ched du gsungs pa //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyang de'i ngo bor rtogs par bya ba'i ched du gsungs pa //
translated: It is also stated for the purpose of realizing that sentient beings have that nature:üîΩ‚ÄúEnlightenment,‚Äù etc.

original: bod du rtogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rang bzhin gyis rang dang phyi'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i phyir dngos po thams cad byang chub la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: bod du rtogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rang bzhin gyis rang dang phyi'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i phyir dngos po thams cad byang chub la gnas pa ste /
translated: Since all things are free from the characteristics of themselves and others by their very nature, they abide in enlightenment.

original: sems can thams cad de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems can thams cad de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that all sentient beings are the nature of the pristine consciousness of suchness.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sangs rgyas rdo rje'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sangs rgyas rdo rje'o //
translated: For that very reason, it is the vajra of the buddhas.

original: 'o na sangs rgyas rnams ni bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i phyir yin la /
analyzed: 'o na sangs rgyas rnams ni bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i phyir yin la /
translated: Well then, since the buddhas are free from afflictions and traces,

original: gzhan rnams la ni de yod pa'i phyir ji ltar de'i ngo bor 'gyur zhes bya ba'i dgos pa gsungs /
analyzed: gzhan rnams la ni de yod pa'i phyir ji ltar de'i ngo bor 'gyur zhes bya ba'i dgos pa gsungs /
translated: how can they be the nature of those who possess them?üîΩThe body vajra and so on are the three vajras.üîΩThe nature of the three vajras is the nonexistence of nature, the vajra reality.

original: sku zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sku gsum gyi bdag nyid ni sku rdo rje la sogs pa rnams kyi de kho na nyid rang bzhin med pa nyid kyi rdo rje chos nyid de gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid nye bar bzung nas
analyzed: sku zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sku gsum gyi bdag nyid ni sku rdo rje la sogs pa rnams kyi de kho na nyid rang bzhin med pa nyid kyi rdo rje chos nyid de gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid nye bar bzung nas
translated: Having taken up the essence of the nondual pristine consciousness,

original: rgyur de byas te /
analyzed: rgyur de byas te /
translated: the cause is made from that.

original: de'i sgo nas sku gsung thugs kyi ye shes thob pa la sangs rgyas rdo rje zhes 'dogs te /
analyzed: de'i sgo nas sku gsung thugs kyi ye shes thob pa la sangs rgyas rdo rje zhes 'dogs te /
translated: The one who obtains the pristine consciousness of body, speech, and mind through that is designated as the vajra of the buddhas.

original: kun rdzob tu ni ji ltar snang ba bzhin du gnas te gang dang yang 'gal ba med do//
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni ji ltar snang ba bzhin du gnas te gang dang yang 'gal ba med do//
translated: Conventionally, things exist just as they appear, and there is no contradiction with anything.üîΩAnd that is also stated in the Samantabhadra

original: de yang kun du bzang po las /
analyzed: de yang kun du bzang po las /
translated: :üîΩThis is the nature of existence and peace;

original: 'di ni srid dang zhi ba'i ngo bo dag / chos nyid dbye ba 'ga' yang yod ma yin //üîΩgang phyir bzung ba la sogs pa rnams dang // bral ba thams cad du ni rtag par grub //
analyzed: 'di ni srid dang zhi ba'i ngo bo dag / chos nyid dbye ba 'ga' yang yod ma yin // gang phyir bzung ba la sogs pa rnams dang // bral ba thams cad du ni rtag par grub //
translated: The reality of things has no divisions at all.üîΩBecause of being free from all grasping, etc.,

original: ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ces gsungs so //
translated: It is always established as being everywhere.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyang mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin las bzhengs te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyang mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin las bzhengs te /
translated: Then the Lord arose from the samadhi of signlessness,

original: de'i don gyi lan bstan pa'i gsungs pa de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de'i don gyi lan bstan pa'i gsungs pa de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and in order to teach the meaning of that, the Bhagavan said, ‚ÄúSubhuti, it is thus.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams ni rang bzhin gyis zhi ba nyid kyi phyir dang / rang bzhin dag cing bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams ni rang bzhin gyis zhi ba nyid kyi phyir dang / rang bzhin dag cing bdag med pa'o //
translated: Attachment, etc., are naturally peaceful, and are pure by nature and selfless.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi cha shas med pa nyid kyi rten dang brten pa'i dngos po dang bral ba'i phyir gnas med pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi cha shas med pa nyid kyi rten dang brten pa'i dngos po dang bral ba'i phyir gnas med pa'o //
translated: Since the realm of phenomena is partless, it is free from the entities of support and supported, and so is baseless.

original: 'di ltar rnam par gnas pa ni chos thams cad bdag med pas thun mong dang cig shos kyi dngos grub kyi mtshan nyid du rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par gnas pa ni chos thams cad bdag med pas thun mong dang cig shos kyi dngos grub kyi mtshan nyid du rtogs pa ste /
translated: Thus, the abiding nature is realized as the characteristic of the common and uncommon powers of all dharmas, because of the selflessness of all dharmas.

original: rdo rje las byung ba zhes bya ba ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: rdo rje las byung ba zhes bya ba ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: Arisen from the vajra means the nature of nondual intuition.

original: smra bar byed pa ni sgrar byed pa dang ston par byed pa zhes bya ba'i @283b tha tshig go //
analyzed: smra bar byed pa ni sgrar byed pa dang ston par byed pa zhes bya ba'i @283b tha tshig go //
translated: It speaks means it makes sound and teaches.

original: de kho na nyid kyi bden par bya ba ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir smra bar bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi bden par bya ba ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir smra bar bya ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not to be spoken because it is not the reality of the truth.

original: bdag las byung ba phung po rnams //
analyzed: bdag las byung ba phung po rnams //
translated: The aggregates arise from the self.

original: de ni dam pa'i don du brdzun //
analyzed: de ni dam pa'i don du brdzun //
translated: That is false in the ultimate sense.

original: gang gis sa bon brdzun yin na //
analyzed: gang gis sa bon brdzun yin na //
translated: If the seed is false,

original: de yi myu gu ji ltar bden //
analyzed: de yi myu gu ji ltar bden //
translated: how can the sprout be true?

original: zhes bya ba rig pa las so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba rig pa las so //
translated: This is from the knowledge.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas dris pa dang / lan gyi rim pas 'di'i don nyid gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas dris pa dang / lan gyi rim pas 'di'i don nyid gsal bar byed do //
translated: Then, etc. clarifies the meaning of this by the sequence of questions and answers.

original: 'di skad gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di skad gsungs te /
translated: This is what is said.

original: dngos grub la sogs pa yang de kho na nyid kyi gnas med pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: dngos grub la sogs pa yang de kho na nyid kyi gnas med pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: And also, the powers and so on are the nature of the intuition which is not the locus of reality.

original: ae ma'o rdo rje ae rdo rje //
analyzed: ae ma'o rdo rje ae rdo rje //
translated: Ah! The vajra, the vajra!

original: zhes bya ba ni ngo mtshar ba'am dga' bar gyur pas lan gnyis su smos pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ngo mtshar ba'am dga' bar gyur pas lan gnyis su smos pa'o //
translated: This is a repetition for the sake of wonder or joy.

original: ngo mtshar dang ni rtsod pa dang / khro dang zhum dang nges bzung dang // dad dang mchog tu dga' ba la //üîΩtshig gcig lan gnyis smos pa yin //
analyzed: ngo mtshar dang ni rtsod pa dang / khro dang zhum dang nges bzung dang // dad dang mchog tu dga' ba la // tshig gcig lan gnyis smos pa yin //
translated: Wonder, dispute, anger, depression, determination, faith, and supreme joy,

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: these are the reasons for repeating a word.

original: rdo rje zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po'i yang chen po'o //
analyzed: rdo rje zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po'i yang chen po'o //
translated: The vajra is the Great of the Great Vehicle.

original: gang du zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid du'o //
analyzed: gang du zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid du'o //
translated: Where is in reality.

original: lus dang ngag sems med ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: lus dang ngag sems med ces bya ba ni /
translated: Without body, speech, or mind

original: sku la sogs pa dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sku la sogs pa dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is because the body and so on are not perceived.

original: de ru gzugs ni lus la sogs pa la brten pa chos kyi dbyings dang tha mi dad pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: de ru gzugs ni lus la sogs pa la brten pa chos kyi dbyings dang tha mi dad pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: There, form is based on the body and so on, and is of the nature of non-differentiation from the Dharma-element.

original: rnam par bsgom zhes bya ba ni brtag par bya ba ste ngo mtshar ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par bsgom zhes bya ba ni brtag par bya ba ste ngo mtshar ba'o //
translated: Contemplated means to be imagined, which is the wonder.

original: rig pa'i brtul zhugs spyad pa zhag bdun gyi bar du rang gi lha tshim par byas nas sgrub pa la 'jug par bstan pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: rig pa'i brtul zhugs spyad pa zhag bdun gyi bar du rang gi lha tshim par byas nas sgrub pa la 'jug par bstan pa gsungs pa /
translated: Having satisfied one's deity for seven days by means of the practice of the awareness-hero, one should enter into the rite.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Then, etc.

original: rdo rje gsum ni tshangs pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rdo rje gsum ni tshangs pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The three vajras are Brahma, etc.,

original: sku rdo rje la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sku rdo rje la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because they are the nature of the vajra body, etc.

original: de las mchog ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa khams gsum gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las mchog ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa khams gsum gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The supreme among them are the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas, because they are free from the passion of the three realms.

original: de las mchog ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams te /
analyzed: de las mchog ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams te /
translated: The supreme among them are the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas,

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang bsam pa'i bdag nyid chen pos so /
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang bsam pa'i bdag nyid chen pos so /
translated: because of their great accumulation of merit and knowledge and their great intention.

original: de'i phyir yum mchog ni byang chub kyi sems rdo rje ste thams cad kyi gtso bor gyur pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir yum mchog ni byang chub kyi sems rdo rje ste thams cad kyi gtso bor gyur pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, the supreme mother is the Bodhisattva Vajra, because he is the chief of all.

original: de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: That is stated:

original: rdo rje gsum gyi dbang phyug mchog / ces so //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum gyi dbang phyug mchog / ces so //
translated: The supreme mistress of the three vajras.

original: sangs rgyas dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi dkyil 'khor te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi dkyil 'khor te /
translated: The ‚Äúmandala of the buddhas‚Äù is the mandala of Vairochana.

original: de'i sbyor bas bsgom par bya /
analyzed: de'i sbyor bas bsgom par bya /
translated: One should meditate by means of the yoga of that.

original: de'i dbus su ji lta ba bzhin du sku rdo rje'i sbyor ba byas nas so //
analyzed: de'i dbus su ji lta ba bzhin du sku rdo rje'i sbyor ba byas nas so //
translated: In the middle of that, having performed the yoga of Vajra Body just as before,

original: spyi bor rdo rje rab tu bsgom //
analyzed: spyi bor rdo rje rab tu bsgom //
translated: one should meditate on the vajra on the head.

original: zhes bya ba ni rdo rje 'dzin pa chen @284a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rdo rje 'dzin pa chen @284a * //
translated: This is the Great Vajra Holder.

original: po'o // gang gi tshe thugs kyi dkyil 'khor du sku'i rdo rje bsgom pa de'i tshe mi bskyod pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: po'o // gang gi tshe thugs kyi dkyil 'khor du sku'i rdo rje bsgom pa de'i tshe mi bskyod pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: When one meditates on the vajra of body in the mandala of mind, then one should meditate on Akshobhya.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi spyi bor mi bskyod pa bsgom zhes bya ba la la dag zer ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi spyi bor mi bskyod pa bsgom zhes bya ba la la dag zer ro //
translated: Some say that one should meditate on Akshobhya on the head of all the buddhas.

original: rdo rje 'khor lo 'dzin bsams na //
analyzed: rdo rje 'khor lo 'dzin bsams na //
translated: Having imagined the vajra wheel-holder,

original: zhes bya ba ni de bzhin du rdo rje 'dzin pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par snang mdzad bsgoms na myur du byang chub thob ste dang po'i sgrub pa nyid la de bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de bzhin du rdo rje 'dzin pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par snang mdzad bsgoms na myur du byang chub thob ste dang po'i sgrub pa nyid la de bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: if one meditates on Vairochana together with the vajra-holder, one will quickly attain enlightenment. This is the meaning: it will be so in the very first practice.

original: thams cad rigs kyi bye brag gis //
analyzed: thams cad rigs kyi bye brag gis //
translated: All of them are of the particular family.

original: zhes bya ba ni gang rigs dang 'brel ba'i lha de'i rigs kyi bdag po des cho ga bzhin tshim par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang rigs dang 'brel ba'i lha de'i rigs kyi bdag po des cho ga bzhin tshim par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that the deity who is connected with a particular family is satisfied by the lord of that family, in accordance with the rite.

original: la la dag brjod zin pa'i dbang bskur ba yang 'dir bstan to zer ro //
analyzed: la la dag brjod zin pa'i dbang bskur ba yang 'dir bstan to zer ro //
translated: Some say that the previously mentioned consecration is also taught here.

original: de'i phyogs la nyi ma bdun po zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rdo rje don ji ltar 'gyur bar bsam mo //
analyzed: de'i phyogs la nyi ma bdun po zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rdo rje don ji ltar 'gyur bar bsam mo //
translated: In that case, one should consider the meaning of the vajra verse beginning with the seven suns, and so on.

original: dbyings su gyur pa'i rgyal mo che //
analyzed: dbyings su gyur pa'i rgyal mo che //
translated: The great queen who has become the realm

original: zhes bya ba ni sa la sogs pa'i khams kyi rang bzhin rang gi rim pa la gnas pa'i rgyal mo chen mo ni spyan la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sa la sogs pa'i khams kyi rang bzhin rang gi rim pa la gnas pa'i rgyal mo chen mo ni spyan la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: means that the great queens who abide in their own stages, having the nature of the elements such as earth, are LocanƒÅ and so forth.

original: de dag kyang bskul ba'i don du rang gi lha'i sku mnyes par byed par rnam par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang bskul ba'i don du rang gi lha'i sku mnyes par byed par rnam par bsam par bya'o //
translated: And in order to invoke them, one should imagine that they are pleased by the body of one's deity.

original: la la dag bsgrub bya dgug pa na mnyes par byed pa sangs rgyas spyan bsgom par bya'o zhes 'dod de /
analyzed: la la dag bsgrub bya dgug pa na mnyes par byed pa sangs rgyas spyan bsgom par bya'o zhes 'dod de /
translated: Some assert that when summoning the object of attainment, one should meditate on BuddhalocanƒÅ, who pleases.

original: de ni sngar gsungs pa'i phyir 'brel ba med pa'o//
analyzed: de ni sngar gsungs pa'i phyir 'brel ba med pa'o//
translated: That is not connected, because it was previously stated.

original: lag pa'i phyag rgya mi bcing ngo //
analyzed: lag pa'i phyag rgya mi bcing ngo //
translated: Do not bind the hand-seal.

original: zhes bya ba ni sems rnam par g-yeng ba'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sems rnam par g-yeng ba'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is the cause of distraction of the mind.

original: cho ga bzhin du bza' zhes pa ni sbyang ba la sogs pa sngon du song ba bza' ba'o //
analyzed: cho ga bzhin du bza' zhes pa ni sbyang ba la sogs pa sngon du song ba bza' ba'o //
translated: Eat according to the rite means eat what has been purified and so forth beforehand.

original: thams cad cho ga bzhin du spyad //
analyzed: thams cad cho ga bzhin du spyad //
translated: All should be enjoyed according to the rite.

original: ces bya ba ni rigs dang yon tan dang gzugs la sogs pa mi spyad par ji ltar rnyed pa bde bar gshegs pa mchod pa'i don du rang snang ba bzhin legs par sbyangs nas nye bar spyad do //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni rigs dang yon tan dang gzugs la sogs pa mi spyad par ji ltar rnyed pa bde bar gshegs pa mchod pa'i don du rang snang ba bzhin legs par sbyangs nas nye bar spyad do //
translated: This means that one should enjoy what is found, not what is not found, such as family, qualities, form, and so forth, for the purpose of worshipping the Sugatas.

original: dam tshig ji snyed yod pa kun //
analyzed: dam tshig ji snyed yod pa kun //
translated: All the pledges that exist

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rang gi lus la gnas pa'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rang gi lus la gnas pa'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams so //
translated: and so forth refer to the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas who abide in one's body.

original: de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: That is stated:

original: rdo rje gsum gyi dam tshig gis //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum gyi dam tshig gis //
translated: By the pledge of the three vajras

original: zhes bya ba ni sku rdo rje la sogs pa rnams kyis gang 'dir dam tshig gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sku rdo rje la sogs pa rnams kyis gang 'dir dam tshig gsungs pa'o //
translated: This is the pledge of the Vajra Body, etc.

original: de rnams kyis ji ltar rnyed pas rang gi lha cho ga bzhin du mchod par bya'o //
